holidays.name: Cinco de Mayo
holidays.description: A spirited celebration of Mexican heritage, famously marking the Mexican army's unlikely victory over the French at the Battle of Puebla in 1862.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the Battle of Puebla during the Franco-Mexican War, gaining popularity mainly in the United States as a day to celebrate Mexican culture.
holidays.funFact: Despite its festive reputation, Cinco de Mayo is somewhat minor in Mexico, where the bigger celebration is Mexican Independence Day on September 16.

holidays.name: National Astronaut Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the brave men and women who have ventured beyond Earth's atmosphere and to inspire future space explorers.
holidays.origin: Established to commemorate the first American in orbit, Alan Shepard’s historic spaceflight on May 5, 1961.
holidays.funFact: Alan Shepard played golf on the moon during a later Apollo mission — talk about taking the sport to new heights!

holidays.name: National Hoagie Day
holidays.description: A delicious food holiday celebrating the hoagie, the beloved sandwich packed with meats, cheeses, veggies, and all the tasty fixings.
holidays.origin: Originated in Philadelphia, 'hoagie' is said to come from workers called 'Hog Islanders' who made these sandwiches during World War I.
holidays.funFact: The hoagie was once called a 'hero,' 'sub,' or 'grinder,' depending on which region you’re in — but hoagie lovers stay loyal to the Philly name!

holidays.name: Wallpaper Week Begins
holidays.description: An unusual observance marking the start of Wallpaper Week, a celebration of the quirky, colorful, and decorative wall coverings that have adorned homes for centuries.
holidays.origin: Created by the trade industry to shine a spotlight on the creative and sometimes eccentric world of wallpaper design.
holidays.funFact: The oldest known wallpaper was found in a palace from the Ming dynasty in China, dating back to the 14th century!
